cyclone.name: GORDON
cyclone.current_location: about 130 mi SSE of Mobile Alabama
cyclone.trajectory: Tracking northwest across the northern Gulf toward the north-central Gulf Coast, then turning north-northwest over the lower Mississippi Valley.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the Mississippi/Alabama border (close to Dauphin Island–Gulfport area)

weather_observation.watch_coast: West of Shell Beach LA to the Mouth of the Mississippi River and east of Dauphin Island AL to Navarre FL (includes Mobile Bay).
weather_observation.warning_coast: Mouth of the Pearl River to the Alabama-Florida border (includes Mobile Bay).
weather_observation.impacted_coast: North-central Gulf Coast from southeast Louisiana across Mississippi and Alabama to the western Florida Panhandle.
weather_observation.wind: Tropical storm winds (40–65 mph) expected this afternoon and evening with a brief chance of hurricane-force gusts near landfall tonight.
weather_observation.storm_surge: Inundation of 2–4 ft possible in Mobile Bay, highest at high tide and east of landfall point.
weather_observation.rainfall: 4–8 inches with isolated 12 inches possible, producing flash flooding in southwest Alabama.
weather_observation.other_hazards: A few tornadoes possible this afternoon and tonight in coastal Alabama.
